description: Large-scale testing and tracing thousands of early cases have helped Germany contain the virus.
title: German museums and shops open as lockdown eased
title_page: German museums and shops open as lockdown eased - BBC News
maintext: Mr Altmaier, the economy minister and a long-time political ally of Chancellor Angela Merkel, told us that 75% of businesses had never closed, and that they were proceeding with caution while keeping a careful eye on infection rates, since having to re-impose controls could have a "disastrous effect on the economy".
